titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Records Concerning Real Property and Legal Transactions near Cripple Creek, Colorado
Cripple Creek, Guide to Records Concerning Real Property and Legal Transactions
titlestmt.author: by Matthew Daniel Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:13

did.unittitle: Records concerning real property and legal transactions near Cripple Creek, Colorado

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Manuscript and printed indexes and summary volumes prepared by regional abstract companies to record the history of real property titles and other financial and legal transactions in Fremont, Teller, and El Paso counties in Colorado, 1861-1972, with the bulk of the collection dating from the height of the Cripple Creek gold rush, 1890-1910. The records consist chiefly of summary accounts created by regional abstract companies from official records maintained in the Fremont, Teller, and El Paso county clerks' offices to document the acquisition and transfer of real property, mining claims, powers of attorney, and tax delinquencies. The records created by abstract companies are accompanied by small groups of business records from local institutions and individuals, as well as 22 printed maps and one disbound volume of plat maps from the region.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Brian Levine on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 1997.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Records Concerning Real Property and Legal Transactions near Cripple Creek, Colorado is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records Concerning Real Property and Legal Transactions near Cripple Creek, Colorado. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 1997, staff at the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library augmented a detailed inventory of the materials based on descriptions provided by the dealer. This inventory provided the basis for this guide.

bioghist.head: History of the Cripple Creek Region, Colorado
bioghist.p: The Cripple Creek Region encompasses land surrounding the communities of Cripple Creek and Victor in Colorado, southwest of Colorado Springs near the base of Pikes Peak. On October 20, 1890, Robert Miller Womack (1844-1909) discovered a deposit of rich gold ore, which he called the El Paso Lode. Within three years, the population of the region increased from five hundred to over ten thousand. The increasing population, as well as political differences between area miners and mine owners, resulted in the division of El Paso County and a portion of Fremont County to create Teller County in March 1899. The population of the region declined steadily during the early twentieth century as the mines became exhausted and the cost of mining rose relative to the price of gold. Mining increased briefly in 1934 when the federal government raised the price of gold, but all gold mines ceased operation during World War II. Some mines reopened after the war, but all mines in the district were closed by 1961.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript and printed indexes and summary volumes prepared by regional abstract companies to record the history of real property titles and other financial and legal transactions in Fremont, Teller, and El Paso counties in Colorado, 1861-1972, with the bulk of the collection dating from the height of the Cripple Creek gold rush, 1890-1910. The records consist chiefly of summary accounts created by regional abstract companies from official records maintained in the Fremont, Teller, and El Paso county clerks' offices to document the acquisition and transfer of real property, mining claims, powers of attorney, and tax delinquencies. The records created by abstract companies are accompanied by small groups of business records from local institutions and individuals, as well as 22 printed maps and one disbound volume of plat maps from the region.

The records for many of the abstract companies include indices, abstracts arranged by date and type, and records related to sales of real estate for delinquent taxes. Abstract companies represented in the collection include Colorado Springs Abstract Company; Cripple Creek Abstract Company; Cripple Creek District Abstract Company; Cripple Creek, Teller County, Abstract Company; El Paso and Fremont Abstract Company; El Paso County Abstract Company; El Paso County Abstract and Title Guaranty Company; Security Abstract & Title Company; Smith, Barton, McDonald & Co.; Teller and El Paso Abstract Company; and Teller County Abstract Company.

The collection includes a single volume created by the City Treasurer of Cripple Creek Colorado from April 7, 1897 to April 19, 1899, a small group of material created by local businesses, a small amount of financial records for the United Mine Workers of America in 1933, and groups of material created by attorney Hildreth Frost and mining engineer Arthur J. Ventress.

Businesses and organizations whose histories are documented include the Colorado Trading and Transfer Company; Cripple Creek State Bank; First National Bank of Cripple Creek; Golden Cycle Land Corporation; Gould Consolidated Mining Company; Lind Auto Service; Mary McKinney Mining Company; Mechanics' and Traders' Insurance Company of New Orleans; Stratton-Independence Ltd.; and Western Union Telegraph Company.

Maps in the collection chiefly document mining operations in the region. Locations include Allman, Arequa,Cameron, Cripple Creek, Gillett, Goldfield, Independence, Lawrence, and Victor. Several maps also document discrete gold mines; one map depicts the grounds of the Myron Stratton Home in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Records of Identified Abstract Companies 1871-circa 1940. II. Records of Unidentified Abstract Companies, 1861-1940. III. Records of Businesses and Organizations, circa 1895-circa 1972. IV. Records of Individuals, 1901-1926. V. Maps, 1892-1935.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically into ten subseries for each abstract company.

Companies representated in this series consist of Colorado Springs Abstract Company; Cripple Creek Abstract Company; Cripple Creek District Abstract Company; Cripple Creek, Teller County, Abstract Company; El Paso and Fremont Abstract Company; El Paso County Abstract Company; El Paso County Abstract and Title Guaranty Company; Security Abstract & Title Company; Smith, Barton, McDonald & Co.; Teller and El Paso Abstract Company; Teller County Abstract Company.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Colorado Springs Abstract Co. was an abstract company based in Colorado Springs, Colorado, 1890-circa 1909.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged under four headings: Indices, Abstracts of Legal Instruments in El Paso and Teller Counties by Date, Abstracts of Legal Instruments in El Paso County by Type, Sale Records for Delinquent Tax in Teller County

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically.

Laid-in list indexes the locations in the volume.

scopecontent.p: Abstracts of legal instruments, probably in El Paso County.

Alphanumeric designations for volumes refer to designations applied to the original record book in the county clerk's office, not to a sequence of volumes in the abstract company's office. Consequently a bound volume may abstract several volumes of legal instruments.

Volume 219 abstracts trusts and mortgages from December 11, 1895, to January 14, 1896.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chiefly abstracts warranty deeds in the Town of Fremont.
Page 17 abstracts the platting of the Town of Fremont in El Paso County by Horace W. Bennett and Julius A. Myers on November 4, 1891.
Pages 1-14 also include entries for patents, quit claim deeds, receipts, release deeds, and trust deeds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chiefly abstracts of warranty deeds and quit claim deeds in Fremont, as well as the Hayden Placer Company subdivision northeast of Fremont.

scopecontent.p: Pages 3851-3956 covers June 30, 1888, to December 31, 1889.
Pages 3957-3967 arranged in descending chronology and covers August 27, 1884, to May 2, 1885.
Pages 3968-4014 covers July 31, 1867, to August 26, 1884.
Pages 4001-4015 transposed in the volume

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laid-in abstracts of legal instruments, February 13, 1890; January 30, 1891; and May 9, 1891.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a tipped in Letters of Administration, February 1, 1894, that appoints Anna A. Faulkner as the administratrix for the estate of Simon P. Faulkner (died January 23, 1894)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes tipped in a decree from the District Court of El Paso County in The Mt. Roan Mining, Milling and Land Company versus John D. O'Haire, Jeremiah O'Driscoll, and J. W. Glackin .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents the sale of property for delinquent taxes in EL Paso County.

did.unittitle: Tax Sale Record, El Paso County

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First portion documents Book 5 for the sale of property for delinquent taxes on December 10-11, 1896, with certificate entries 1-1420.
Second portion documents Book 6 for the sale of property for delinquent taxes on December 11-13, 1897, with certificate entries 1-1441.
Third portion documents Book 7 for the sale of property for delinquent taxes on December 5-6, 1898, with certificate entries 1-1700.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records related to legal instruments applied to real estate in Fremont County. Many of these records were likely compiled by unidentified abstract companies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged under three headings: Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Date, Sale Records for Delinquent Taxes, and Survey Notes.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Fremont County was one of the original seventeen counties created by the Colorado legislature on November 1, 1861.

did.unittitle: Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Entry Number and Type

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially by entry number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of volumes with mimeograph pages of abstracts of legal instruments in Fremont County arranged by date that likely document real estate within or adjoining the Cripple Creek region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 1-98 record varied legal instruments
Entries 99-999 record discovery and location certificates for mines, including a series for placer mines in entries 4513-4598.

did.unittitle: Entries 1000-2001 (Discovery and Location Certificates for Mines)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laid-in notes relate to the Josephina Lode, May 21, 1894, on the back of a paper announcing the move of The El Paso and Fremont Abstract Co., April 25, 1896.

did.unittitle: Entries 2002-2999 (Discovery and Location Certificates for Mines)
Entries 3000-3998 (Discovery and Location Certificates for Mines)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 3999-4875 record discovery and location certificates for mines, including a series for placer mines in entries 4513-4598.
Entries 4876-4999 record conveyances of mining deeds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 5999-6313 record conveyances of mining deeds.
Entries 6314-6462 record quit claim deeds.
Entries 6463-6604 record bell notices.
Entries 6605-6806 record sweet notices (notices of action).
Entries 6809-7001 record labor affidavits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 7001-7510 record labor affidavits.
Entries 7511-7998 record incorporation actions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 7999-8065 record incorporation actions.
Entries 8066-8774 record varied legal instruments.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Tax Sale Record, Fremont County, Entries 1881-3503 and 1-1420

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First portion documents the sale of property for delinquent taxes on December 8, 1899, with certificate entries 1-1420.

Second portion documents the sale of property for delinquent taxes in Fremont County from December 3, 1893, to December 13, 1898, certificate entries 1881-3503, for properties that later became part of Teller County after its founding on March 23, 1899.

did.unittitle: Tax Sale Record, Fremont County, Entries 1421-4142

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume of carbon copies of survey notes for lodes in Fremont County.
Includes an index to the surveys that includes an alphabetical list of lode names, as well as the claimants and survey numbers.
Many of the notes are faded and unreadable.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records related to legal instruments applied to real estate in Teller County. Many of these records were likely compiled by unidentified abstract companies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged under seven headings: Day Book and Indices; Abstracts of Legal Instruments Related to Mines and Locations; Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Type; Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Date and Type; Sets of Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Date; Delinquent Tax Lists; and Sale Records for Delinquent Tax.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Created in 1899, Teller County consists of the western slope of Pikes Peak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ledger with entries for debits and credits probably created by the Teller County Clerk, apart from pages 1-8, which document the daily finances of the Wilson Machinery Company, Cripple Creek, Colorado, June 17 to August 18, 1892.
Pages 9-29 document daily finances, December 27, 1892-October 2,1893.
Pages 35-73 are the names of mines grouped roughly alphabetically, with additional entries on pages 80, 84, 94, 102
Pages 86-93 document daily finances, February 5-March 3, 1896.
Pages 103-134 document a list of land not partitioned?
Page 300-101 document daily finances, January 30-February 5.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Index to legal instruments for mines in Teller County and filed in Fremont County before the formation of Teller County on March 23, 1899.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ledger of judgments, probably in Teller County, as well as locations formerly in El Paso County, which documents the defendant, plaintiff, case number, legal remedies, usually compensatory damages, and the date satisfied.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Entries grouped alphabetically by the surname or corporate name of the defendant.

did.unittitle: Journal of Various Lode Names and a Cash Journal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Missing pages 1-68.
Pages 69-134 documents lodes, probably in Teller County, each with a list of legal instructs applied to the lode, circa 1898-1927.
Pages 100-103, which document a cash journal, November 15, 1909, to December 17, 1910.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Index to legal instruments related to incorporation, probably in Teller County, including articles of incorporation, amendments, and dissolutions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Entries grouped alphabetically by the corporate name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Index to legal instruments related to grants of power of attorney, probably in Teller County.
Each entry has been struck out in pencil.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Entries grouped alphabetically by the principal granting the power.

did.unittitle: Mining Claim Owners and Assessments, M-Z

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ledger of mining claims, probably in Teller County, which includes: the name of the claim; survey number; acreage; and the section, township, and range of the claim; as well as its own and value per acre for each year, 1907-1911.

did.unittitle: Index to Miscellaneous Towns and Additions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Index to property lots in towns, additions, and subdivisions. Settlements include Anaconda, Cripple Creek, Florissant, Highland Grove, Independence, Lanter City, Victor, and Woodland Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alphabetical index of mines that record entry numbers of conveyences.

did.unittitle: Abstracts of Legal Instruments Related to Mines and Locations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abstracts of legal instruments arranged roughly alphabetically by mine names and bound in volumes.
Each volume includes a list of lodes and locations with abstracts in the volume.

did.unittitle: Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Type

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Numeric designations for volumes refer to designations applied to the original record book in the county clerk's office, not to a sequence of volumes in the abstract company's office. Consequently a bound volume may abstract several volumes of legal instruments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound volume with abstracts from three books.
Book 155 abstracts deeds of trust March 6, to July 14, 1896.
Book 156 abstracts mining deeds January 3, to June 2, 1893
Book 157 abstracts trustee deeds, June 28, 1893, to January 11, 1896.

did.unittitle: Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Date and Type

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abstracts for legal instruments for mines Teller County and filed in El Paso and Fremont Counties for legal acts before the formation of Teller County on March 23, 1899. Some entries were filed in Fremont County after the formation of Teller County.
Each entry has two numbers: a sequential number and another number that references a filing number.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially by title on the spine of the volume.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 1-98 (14301-52293) are not sequentially or chronologically arranged in the volume and abstract mine locations, July 10, 1884, to December 12, 1899.
Entries 99-997 (22636-26360) abstract mine locations November 12, 1891, to November 9, 1893.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 3999-4512 (40462-53561) abstract mine locations November 12, 1891, to April 23, 1900
Entries 4513-4598 (23328-47772) abstract placer mine locations April 6, 1892, to March 11, 1899.
Entries 4599-4725 (34466-48555) abstract mine locations with amendments February 1, 1896, to November 29, 1898.
Entries 4726-4875 (34373-49960) abstract mine locations with amendments and additions January 31, 1896, to March 23, 1899.
Entries 4876-4999 (23326-27655) abstract conveyances of mine deeds April 6, 1892, to April 30, 1894.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abstract conveyances of mine deeds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 5999-6313 (44504-51606) abstract conveyances of mine deeds September 28, 1897, to September 26, 1899.
Entries 6314-6462 (24360-49669) abstract quit claim deeds September 13, 1892, to March 6, 1899.
Entries 6463-6604 (26457-27431) abstract bell notices December 4, 1893, to April 3, 1894.
Entries 6605-6806 (28869-31534) abstract sweet notices September 27, 1894, to July 5, 1895.
Entries 6807-7000 (24849-33476) abstract labor affidavits December 27, 1892, to January 9, 1896.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 7001-7510 (33477-50078) abstract labor affidavits January 9, 1896, to March 3, 1899.
Entries 7511-7998 (23376-43327) abstract acts of incorporation and certificates of paid stock February 1, 1894, to May 12, 1897.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries 7999-8065 (43328-49809) abstract acts of incorporation and certificates of paid stock May 12, 1897, to March 13, 1899.

Entries 8066-8676 (30033-45785) are not chronologically arranged, although some sequences have a general chronological organization. The entries abstract various legal instruments, January 1, 1892, to March 15, 1899.
Entries 8677-8761 (32564-38763) abstract mining location certificates November 30, 1895, to May 26, 1896.
Entries 8762-8775 (31113-48727) abstract judgments May 9, 1895, to December 17, 1898.

Entries 8776-8831 (24858-30215) are not chronologically arranged, although some sequences have a general chronological organization. The entries abstract mine surveys October 5, 1894, to December 2, 1898.

did.unittitle: Abstracts of Legal Instruments by Date

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material under this heading is arranged into two sets: First Set, 1899-1917; and Second Set, 1899-1933.

scopecontent.p: 2 copies

scopecontent.p: 2 copies

scopecontent.p: 2 copies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Possibly County Clerk Ledgers for Teller County
Each volume designation is composed of four bound volumes. Each bound volume contains 250 pages.
Bound carbon copies of typescripts.
Also includes references to earlier entries to reflect redemptions, usually through paying taxes
Some entries appear out of order within a few days.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon copies of manuscript entries that are abstracts of legal instruments in Teller County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laid-in items include notes about the foreclosure sale of Colorado Electric Power Co. to W. S. Mitchell on July 5, 1904, and typescript of a decree regarding Larry Maroney v. The Gold Mining Stock Exchange on April 25, 1906.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laid-in a special master's deed from Igor O. Wingren and George M. Taylor to W. D. Corley, recorded November 27, 1922, and a quit claim deed from Thomas Kavanaugh to The Ironclad Hill Mining and Development Company, recorded November 27, 1922.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of legal instruments reflected in the volume.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially by entry number.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically
Within each volume lists are arranged alphabetically by subject or location.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings of delinquent tax lists from the Cripple Creek Times , Victor Daily Record , and the The Times-Record newspapers. The lists often include listings for delinquent taxes for previous years.
Some volumes contain multiple years. Some years appear across different volumes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material under this heading is arranged into three sets: First Set, 1890-1937; Second Set, 1902-1912; and Third Set, 1902-1908.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some volumes contain multiple years. Some years overlap across different volumes.
Volumes covering years prior to 1899 probably document real estate sold in El Paso and Fremont Counties that became part of Teller County.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by sales dates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript volumes.
Occasional notes document redemption of tax debts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 copies

did.unittitle: Tax Sale Record, Teller County, Entries 1-2463 and 8597-11737

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First portion documents the sale of property for delinquent taxes November 17-18, 1902, with certificate entries 1-2463.
Second portion documents the sale of property for delinquent taxes November 20-21, 1908, with certificate entries 8597-9414.

did.unittitle: Tax Sale Record, Teller County, 1902, Entries 2464-5313

scopecontent.p: Entries kept in a ledger book printed for The Home Insurance Company, New York.

did.unittitle: Tax Sale Record, Teller County, 1903, Entries 5314-8088

scopecontent.p: Entries kept in a ledger book printed for the Springfield Fire & Marine Insurance Company.

scopecontent.p: Entries kept in a ledger book printed for the Springfield Fire & Marine Insurance Company.

scopecontent.p: Entries kept in a ledger book printed for The Home Insurance Company, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries kept in a ledger book printed for The Home Insurance Company, New York.

did.unittitle: Discrete Records from Unidentified Abstract Companies

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records created by unidentified abstract companies and other businesses, including the records of a sawmill and hardware store.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pages 2-83 document expenditures in cash and check, August 1, 1895-December 4, 1897.

Pages 84-132 document surveys of mines, including the Oversight Fraction Lode, April 30-May 1, 1948; the Albertson Lode and Josephine Lode, May 23-June 2, 1948; the Florence Lode, October 20, 1948; and the Fluorspar Lode on May 20, 1953.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume of carbon copies of location certificates for lodes in Chaffee County, El Paso County, Fremont County.
Includes an index to the certificates that includes an alphabetical list of lode names, as well as the claimants and page numbers.
Several notes are faded and unreadable.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alphabetical index to the Victor office of an unidentified business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings of mining and patent applications in the Cripple Creek Mining District published by the United States Land Office, Pueblo, Colorado. The clippings document circa 900 applications.
Manuscript inscriptions record names of individual lodes and mines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries grouped alphabetically by the surname or corporate name.

did.unittitle: Ledger of Customer Accounts and Expenses

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Possibly a ledger for an abstract company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Possibly a ledger for an abstract company. It includes an account at the Hamilton National Bank in Denver, Colorado, as well as accounts of expenses, bills payable, cash on hand, rental income, salaries, interest, and profits.
Many pages are missing from the volume.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Possibly a ledger for an abstract company. It includes an account at the Trust National Bank, cash, ore hauling, drayage, ice, sales, and sales tax, as well as offices in Victor and Cripple Creek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries include amounts for bran, building material, cash sales, coal, hay, lime, miscellaneous, and sales tax.
Kept in a ledger for the Security Insurance Company of New Haven, Connecticut, Western Department, Rockford, Illinois.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically into fifteen subseries for each organization.

Organizations representated in this series consist of Colorado Trading and Transfer Company; Cripple Creek, City Treasurer; Cripple Creek State Bank; First National Bank of Cripple Creek; Golden Cycle Land Corporation; Gould Consolidated Mining Company; Lind Auto Service; Mary McKinney Mining Company; Mechanics' and Traders' Insurance Company of New Orleans; Mechanics' and Traders' Insurance Company of New Orleans; Pikes Peak Cottage City Corporation; Stratton-Independence Ltd.; United Mine Workers of America; Western Union Telegraph Company; Unidentified Sawmill and Hardware Store, and Unidentified Mines.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Colorado Trading and Transfer Company was a drayage company founded by Albert Eugene Carlton that hauled freight from railroad stations into Cripple Creek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes columns for bran, building material, coal, flour, hay, ice, oats, and miscellaneous.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The City Treasurer of Cripple Creek had responsibility for managing the funds of the city, as well as issuing and repaying debt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents several municipal accounts including the building fund; contingent fund; dog pound tax fund; election fund; electric light fund; fire department fund; general fund; poll tax fund; printing fund; public library fund; salary fund; sewer tax fund; streets, bridges, and alleys fund; the city clerk, Dallas C. Weyand; the city collectors, C. M. Hoopes and W. L. Smith; the police magistrates, John E. Rinker and H. H. Whiting; and water fund; as well as interest accrued from funds.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Cripple Creek State Bank was a bank in Cripple Creek, Colorado, November 1904 to January 1921.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes laid-in sheets from a ledger, January 2, 1920, to May 31, 1920.

did.unittitle: First National Bank of Cripple Creek

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The First National Bank of Cripple Creek was founded by Jim M. Parker in 1893.

did.unittitle: Index to Ledger, A-L Book, E

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes entries for names, arranged alphabetically.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Golden Cycle Land Corporation was a land development company. Between 1970 and 1973, it subdivided an area that became known as Cripple Creek Mountain Estates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially by the numbers applied to subdivisions in the volumes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alphabetical lists of property owners in subdivisions established by the Golden Cycle Land Corporation in Cripple Creek, Colorado.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Gould Consolidated Mining Company was a mining company in Cripple Creek District, Teller County, Colorado, May 1901-March 1904. It was succeeded by the Gould Mining Company, which operated until April 1912, when it was succeeded by the Kittie Lane Gold Mining Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ledger of stock certificates issued and cancelled by the Gould Consolidated Mining Company May 4, 1901, to March 14, 1904, as well as the Gould Mining Company, March 7, 1904, to April 8, 1912, and the Kittie Lane Gold Mining Company, March 8, 1912, to July 22, 1925.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Lind Auto Service was an automobile repair and welding business in Cañon City, Colorado, circa 1918-1966.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ledger documents ore received and used, May 11, 1918, to May 24, 1919, as well as business income and expenditures January 6, 1944, to December 10, 1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alphabetical ledger of accounts.
Laid-in receipts document payment for some accounts.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Mary McKinney Mining Company operated in Cripple Creek, Colorado, 1892-1911. It reincorporated in 1912.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents expenses of the company.

did.unittitle: Mechanics' and Traders' Insurance Company of New Orleans

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Mechanics' and Traders' Insurance Company of New Orleans was organized in 1869.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ledger kept by George T. Wood, an agent in Cripple Creek, Colorado, for the Mechanics' and Traders' Insurance Company of New Orleans. Leaves of the volume include description of insurance policies, as well as affixed copies of the policies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Entries and policies arranged chronologically in the volume.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Pikes Peak Cottage City Corporation was a private campground near Colorado Springs, Colorado.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Winfield Scott Stratton (1848-1902) discovered the Independence Lode near Victor, Colorado on July 4, 1891. In 1900, Stratton sold the Independence Mine to the Venture Corporation of London, incorporated the property as Stratton-Independence Ltd.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tally of samples of mill dirt, which represents that ore worked by a mill, probably at the Independence Mill in Victor, Colorado, as well as the quantity of tons of mill dirt processed by the mill, May 1, 1917-May 12, 1919.

did.unittitle: Direct Primary Election Ballot, Republican Party, Precinct No. 2, Teller County, Colorado

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Republican candidates for state and local offices, including Ralph Lawrence Carr (1887-1950) from Cripple Creek, Colorado, for governor. Carr served as the 29th Governor of Colorado, 1939-1943.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The United Mine Workers of America is a North American labor union founded in 1890 and known for representing coal miners and coal technicians.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blank cash book printed for a local union of the United Mine Workers of America.
Laid-in sheets, dated December 18, 1933, document local unions in arrears and new transfer books issued to local unions.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Formed in 1855, Western Union Telegraph Company is a financial services and communications company based in the United States.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Journal and ledgers for a saw mill and hardware store, probably in Cripple Creek, Colorado.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries identify the customer account in ledger, as well as merchandise and the dimensions of lumber ordered, the total linear feet of wood, and the cost.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assay analyses for ore samples from mines for moisture.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by the surname of each individual into ? subseries.
Individuals representated in this series consist of Hildreth Frost and Arthur J. Ventress.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Hildreth Frost (1880-1955) was an attorney specializing in mining issues in Teller County, Colorado. Frost was born in Massachusetts, and graduated from Colorado College in 1901 and from Harvard University with a law degree in 1904. Frost also a captain in the National Guard of Colorado and commanded Company A of the Second Infantry, 1911-1916, and served as a Judge Advocate during the southern Colorado Coal Strike, 1913-1914.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound volume with carbon-copies of opinions on titles, which includes opinions written for family members.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged into a single heading of Account Journals.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Arthur J. Ventress (1871-1905) was a surveyor and mining engineer. He died in an accident in the Newhouse (Argo) Tunnel in Idaho Springs, Colorado.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account journals while working as a surveyor for Clear Creek County, probably based in Georgetown, Colorado. Includes notes on surveys and employees, including James Augustus Ingols (1874-1937), Deems, and Thomas.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by creator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Maps that chiefly provide overviews of the Cripple Creek Region, as well as localities and mines.
Descriptions of scale for individual maps has been applied when readily available.

did.unittitle: Adams, Jacob R., Map of Goldfield, Colorado
Altman Water Company, The Altman Water Works System, Cripple Creek Mining District, Teller County, Colorado

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Map of the pipelines in the water system in the vicinity of West Beaver Creek.

did.unittitle: Cameron Mines, Land and Tunnel Company, Cameron, Colorado
Charles J. Hotchkiss Co., Mining Map of the Cripple Creek District , Colorado. Denver: Chas. J. Hotchkiss

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mining map which documents mines in the Cripple Creek District, Colorado, including the communities of Arequa, Cameron, Cripple Creek, Gillett, and Victor.

did.unittitle: Codding, Chas. H., Map of Teller County

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes county roads, toll roads, railroads, school district boundaries, school lands, and deeded lands.
Scale: 1 inch to 25000 feet

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Alfred Bundy Colwell (1868-1920) was a civil engineer in Cripple Creek, Colorado.

did.unittitle: Colwell, Alfred B., Map of the Bonanza King Lode: Property of the Gold Hill Bonanza Mining Company , Cripple Creek, Colorado

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scale 1 inch to 40 feet.

did.unittitle: Colwell, Alfred B., Title Plats of the Midget Gold Mining and Milling Co. , Cripple Creek, Colorado

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Disbound volume of plat maps related to the Midget Gold Mining and Milling Co.
Includes plats for Brayton Lode, Cumberland Lode, Maryland Lode, Midget Lode, Protection Lode, and Sunnyside Lode.
Scale 1 inch to 200 feet.

did.unittitle: Colwell, Alfred B., and Edward L. Haff, Map of the Midget Mine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scale 1 inch to 100 feet.

did.unittitle: Davis, Lee W., and Byler, Emmett A.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Lee W. Davis (born 1866) and Emmett A. Byler (born 1868) operated mine engineering and surveying firms in Colorado and Nevada.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John St. J. Lallie (born 1864) was an attorney and proprietor of the Western Mathematical Instrument Works and the Lallie Instrument Co. in Denver, Colorado.

did.unittitle: Reid, Herbert I., Myron Stratton Home Grounds, Colorado Springs, Colorado

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Winfield Scott Stratton (1848-1902) left the bulk of his estate for the establishment of the Myron Stratton Home, for "the aged poor and dependent children" in Colorado Springs, Colorado, which he named for his father. After a series of lengthy probate challenges, the home was established in 1913.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes locations of the administration building, dairy barn, dining room, greenhouse, halls, infirmary, powerhouse, storage buildings, superintendent building, and swimming pool.
Scale: 1 inch to 30 feet.
Engraved by Sanford and Phillips.
Revised June 1, 1938 and April 1, 1939.
